    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

richtext.encode.hover.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

richtext.encode.hover.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

richtext.encode.hover.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

richtext.encode.hover.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

richtext.encode.hover.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

richtext.encode.hover.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

richtext.encode.hover.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

richtext.encode.hover.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

richtext.encode.hover.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

richtext.encode.hover.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

richtext.encode.hover.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

richtext.encode.hover.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

richtext.encode.hover.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

richtext.encode.hover.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

richtext.encode.hover.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

richtext.encode.hover.cursor.desc:
The mouse cursor style of the graphic, similar to DOM styles:

  • 'auto'
  • 'default'
  • 'none'
  • 'context-menu'
  • 'help'
  • 'pointer'
  • 'progress'
  • 'wait'
  • 'cell'
  • 'crosshair'
  • 'text'
  • 'vertical-text'
  • 'alias'
  • 'copy'
  • 'move'
  • 'no-drop'
  • 'not-allowed'
  • 'grab'
  • 'grabbing'
  • 'all-scroll'
  • 'col-resize'
  • 'row-resize'
  • 'n-resize'
  • 'e-resize'
  • 's-resize'
  • 'w-resize'
  • 'ne-resize'
  • 'nw-resize'
  • 'se-resize'
  • 'sw-resize'
  • 'ew-resize'
  • 'ns-resize'
  • 'nesw-resize'
  • 'nwse-resize'
  • 'zoom-in'
  • 'zoom-out'

richtext.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

richtext.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

richtext.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

richtext.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

richtext.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

richtext.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

richtext.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

richtext.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

richtext.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

richtext.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

richtext.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

richtext.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

richtext.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

richtext.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

richtext.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

richtext.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

richtext.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

richtext.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

richtext.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

richtext.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

richtext.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

richtext.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

richtext.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

richtext.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

richtext.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

richtext.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

richtext.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

richtext.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

richtext.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

richtext.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

richtext.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

richtext.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

richtext.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

richtext.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

richtext.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

richtext.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

richtext.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

richtext.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

richtext.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

richtext.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

richtext.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

richtext.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

richtext.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

richtext.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

richtext.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

richtext.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

richtext.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

richtext.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

text.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

text.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

text.encode.enter.maxLineWidth.desc: Maximum width, when this value is set, and the automatic ellipsis strategy is enabled, ellipsis symbols will be automatically added

text.encode.enter.ellipsis.desc:
When the text is too long, the ellipsis related configuration, supports two types of configuration:

  • 'string' Enable automatic ellipsis and set the ellipsis symbol
  • 'boolean' Whether to enable automatic ellipsis, the default ellipsis symbol is '...'

text.encode.enter.lineThrough.desc: Whether to display strikethrough

text.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

text.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

text.encode.enter.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic

  x0: 0,

    }
  ],

  • Radial gradient

{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

text.encode.enter.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

text.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

text.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

text.encode.enter.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

text.encode.enter.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

text.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

text.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

text.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

text.encode.enter.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

text.encode.enter.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

text.encode.enter.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

text.encode.enter.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

text.encode.enter.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

text.encode.enter.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

text.encode.enter.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

text.encode.enter.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

text.encode.enter.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.enter.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.enter.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

text.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

text.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

text.encode.enter.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%

    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

text.encode.hover.desc: Set the visual channel mapping corresponding to the graphics elements when in the hover state.

text.encode.hover.maxLineWidth.desc: Maximum width, when this value is set, and the automatic ellipsis strategy is enabled, ellipsis symbols will be automatically added

text.encode.hover.ellipsis.desc:
When the text is too long, the ellipsis related configuration, supports two types of configuration:

  • 'string' Enable automatic ellipsis and set the ellipsis symbol
  • 'boolean' Whether to enable automatic ellipsis, the default ellipsis symbol is '...'

text.encode.hover.lineThrough.desc: Whether to display strikethrough

text.encode.hover.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

text.encode.hover.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

text.encode.hover.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

  • Conical gradient

text.encode.hover.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

text.encode.hover.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

text.encode.hover.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

text.encode.hover.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

text.encode.hover.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

text.encode.hover.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

text.encode.hover.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

text.encode.hover.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

text.encode.hover.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

text.encode.hover.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

text.encode.hover.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

text.encode.hover.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

text.encode.hover.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

text.encode.hover.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

text.encode.hover.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

text.encode.hover.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

text.encode.hover.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.hover.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.hover.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

text.encode.hover.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

text.encode.hover.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

text.encode.hover.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

text.encode.hover.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{

    }
  ],

  • Radial gradient

{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {

    },

    }
  ]

    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

text.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

text.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

text.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

text.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

text.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

text.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

text.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

text.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

text.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

text.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

text.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

text.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

text.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

text.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

text.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

text.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

text.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

text.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

text.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

text.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

text.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

text.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

text.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

text.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

text.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

text.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

text.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

text.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

text.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

text.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

text.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

text.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

text.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

text.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

text.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

text.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

text.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

text.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

text.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

text.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

text.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

text.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

text.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

text.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

text.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

text.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

text.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

text.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

interval.type.desc: Set the graphic element type to interval

interval.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

interval.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

interval.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

interval.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }

  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}

interval.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

interval.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

interval primitive additional supported animation types include:

  • growIntervalIn/growIntervalOut: Growing animation

interval.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

interval.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

interval.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

interval.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

interval.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

interval.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

interval.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

interval.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

interval.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

interval.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

interval.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

interval.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

interval.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

interval.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

interval.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

interval.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

interval.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

interval.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

interval.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

interval.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

interval.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

interval.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

interval.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interval.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

interval.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interval.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

interval.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

interval.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

interval.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

interval.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

interval.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

interval.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

interval.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

interval.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

interval.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

interval.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

interval.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

interval.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

interval.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

interval.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

interval.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

interval.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

interval.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

interval.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

interval.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

interval.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

cell.type.desc: Set the graphic element type to cell

cell.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

cell.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

cell.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

cell.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

cell.encode.enter.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

cell.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

cell.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

cell.encode.enter.lineCap.desc:

  • 'butt'

  • 'square'

cell.encode.enter.lineJoin.desc:

cell.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

cell.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

cell.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

cell.encode.enter.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

cell.encode.enter.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

cell.encode.enter.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

cell.encode.enter.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

cell.encode.enter.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

cell.encode.enter.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

cell.encode.enter.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

cell.encode.enter.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.enter.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.enter.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

cell.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

cell.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

cell.encode.update.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.update.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.update.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

cell.encode.update.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

cell.encode.update.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

cell.encode.update.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

cell.encode.update.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

cell.encode.update.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

cell.encode.exit.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds
