// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

cell.encode.hover.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

cell.encode.hover.cursor.desc:
The mouse cursor style of the graphic, similar to DOM styles:

  • 'auto'
  • 'default'
  • 'none'
  • 'context-menu'
  • 'help'
  • 'pointer'
  • 'progress'
  • 'wait'
  • 'cell'
  • 'crosshair'
  • 'text'
  • 'vertical-text'
  • 'alias'
  • 'copy'
  • 'move'
  • 'no-drop'
  • 'not-allowed'
  • 'grab'
  • 'grabbing'
  • 'all-scroll'
  • 'col-resize'
  • 'row-resize'
  • 'n-resize'
  • 'e-resize'
  • 's-resize'
  • 'w-resize'
  • 'ne-resize'
  • 'nw-resize'
  • 'se-resize'
  • 'sw-resize'
  • 'ew-resize'
  • 'ns-resize'
  • 'nesw-resize'
  • 'nwse-resize'
  • 'zoom-in'
  • 'zoom-out'

cell.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

cell.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

cell.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

cell.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

cell.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

cell.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

cell.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

cell.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

cell.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

cell.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

cell.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

cell.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

cell.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

cell.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

cell.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

cell.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

cell.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

cell.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

cell.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

cell.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

cell.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

cell.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

cell.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

cell.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

cell.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

cell.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

cell.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

cell.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

cell.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

cell.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

cell.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

cell.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

cell.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

cell.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

cell.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

cell.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

cell.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

cell.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

cell.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

cell.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

cell.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

cell.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

cell.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

cell.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

cell.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

cell.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

cell.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

cell.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

group.clip.desc: Whether the group mark clips its child marks

group.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

group.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

group.encode.enter.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two types of setting:

  • number: Set the same border radius for all four corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner
    • When the array length is 1, set the same border radius for all four corners
    • When the array length is 2 or 3, set border radius of top-left and bottom-right corners to borderRadius[0], and border radius of top-right and bottom-left corners to borderRadius[1]
    • When the array length is 4 or more, set different border radius for each corner

group.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

group.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

group.encode.enter.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient

    }
  ],

  • Radial gradient

  r0: 0,

  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,

    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

group.encode.enter.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

group.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

group.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

group.encode.enter.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

group.encode.enter.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

group.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

group.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

group.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

group.encode.enter.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

group.encode.enter.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

group.encode.enter.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

group.encode.enter.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

group.encode.enter.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

group.encode.enter.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

group.encode.enter.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

group.encode.enter.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

group.encode.enter.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.enter.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.enter.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

group.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

group.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

group.encode.enter.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

group.encode.update.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data update state.

group.encode.update.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two types of setting:

  • number: Set the same border radius for all four corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner
    • When the array length is 1, set the same border radius for all four corners
    • When the array length is 2 or 3, set border radius of top-left and bottom-right corners to borderRadius[0], and border radius of top-right and bottom-left corners to borderRadius[1]
    • When the array length is 4 or more, set different border radius for each corner

group.encode.update.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

group.encode.update.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

group.encode.hover.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

group.encode.hover.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

group.encode.hover.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

group.encode.hover.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

group.encode.hover.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

group.encode.hover.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

group.encode.hover.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

group.encode.hover.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

group.encode.hover.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

group.encode.hover.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',

    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],

group.encode.hover.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

group.encode.hover.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

group.encode.hover.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

group.encode.hover.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

group.encode.hover.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

group.encode.hover.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

group.encode.hover.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

group.encode.hover.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.hover.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.hover.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

group.encode.hover.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

group.encode.hover.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

group.encode.hover.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

group.encode.hover.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

group.encode.hover.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

group.encode.hover.cursor.desc:
The mouse cursor style of the graphic, similar to DOM styles:

  • 'auto'
  • 'default'
  • 'none'
  • 'context-menu'
  • 'help'
  • 'pointer'
  • 'progress'
  • 'wait'
  • 'cell'
  • 'crosshair'
  • 'text'
  • 'vertical-text'
  • 'alias'
  • 'copy'
  • 'move'
  • 'no-drop'
  • 'not-allowed'
  • 'grab'
  • 'grabbing'
  • 'all-scroll'
  • 'col-resize'
  • 'row-resize'
  • 'n-resize'
  • 'e-resize'
  • 's-resize'
  • 'w-resize'
  • 'ne-resize'
  • 'nw-resize'
  • 'se-resize'
  • 'sw-resize'
  • 'ew-resize'
  • 'ns-resize'
  • 'nesw-resize'
  • 'nwse-resize'
  • 'zoom-in'
  • 'zoom-out'

group.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

group.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

group.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

group.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

group.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

group.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

group.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

group.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

group.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

group.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

group.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

group.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

group.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

group.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

group.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

group.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

group.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

group.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

group.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

group.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

group.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

group.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

group.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

group.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

group.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

group.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

group.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

group.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

group.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

group.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

group.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

group.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

group.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

group.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

group.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

group.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

group.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

group.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

group.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

group.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

group.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

group.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

group.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

group.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

group.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

group.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

group.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

group.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

glyph.type.desc: Set the chart element type to glyph

glyph.glyphType.desc: Set the glyph type, supporting built-in glyph types, as well as custom registered glyph types

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.desc: Execute registerBarBoxplotGlyph() to register the barBoxplot glyph before using the boxplot glyph

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.glyphConfig.desc:
Supported glyph configurations include:

  • direction('vertical'|'horizontal'): The direction of the barBoxplot glyph, default is 'vertical'

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.animation.desc:
Supported built-in animation types include:

  • barBoxplotScaleIn/barBoxplotScaleOut: Animation of the barBoxplot glyph growing along the median line

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.encode.enter..desc: Max value coordinate of the element
Min value coordinate of the element
1/4 value coordinate of the element
3/4 value coordinate of the element
Median value coordinate of the element
Fill opacity of the min and max value bars
Width of the min and max value bars
Height of the min and max value bars
Width of the q1q3 value bars
Height of the q1q3 value bars
Graphic element's x coordinate
Graphic element's y coordinate
Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics
Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}
Graphic element's fill opacity

Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,

  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.setCustomized.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.displa.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.callba.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.skipBe.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.update.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.maxChi.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.positi.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.paddin.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

glyph.glyphType.barBoxplot.layout.gridTe.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.desc: Before using the boxplot glyph, you need to execute registerBoxplotGlyph() to register the boxplot glyph

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.glyphConfig.desc:
The supported glyph configurations include:

  • direction('vertical'|'horizontal'): The direction of the boxplot glyph, default to 'vertical'

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.animation.desc:
The supported built-in animation types include:

  • boxplotScaleIn/boxplotScaleOut: The animation of the boxplot glyph growing along the median line

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.enter.rul.desc: Height of the minMax line part

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.enter.fil.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.exit.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data deletion state.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.exit.rule.desc: Height of the minMax line part

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.exit.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.encode.exit.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.setCustomizedSha.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.skipBefor.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.updateVie.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.maxChildW.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.maxChildH.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridTempl.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridRowGa.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridColum.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridRowSt.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridRowEn.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

glyph.glyphType.boxplot.layout.gridColum.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.desc: Execute registerLinkPathGlyph() to register the linkPath glyph before using it

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.glyphConfig.desc:
Supported glyph configurations include:

  • direction: 'vertical'|'horizontal', the direction of the linkPath glyph, default is 'vertical'

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.cu.desc: Curvature of the graphic element, default is 0.5

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.ro.desc: Whether to round the calculated path of the graphic element

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.di.desc:
Direction of the graphic element

  • 'horizontal'
  • 'vertical'
  • 'LR'
  • 'RL'
  • 'TB'
  • 'BL'
  • 'radial'

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.fi.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.li.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke
Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke
Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.mi.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.st.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.sh.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

The y offset of the graphic shadow

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.sc.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction
The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.an.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.al.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.enter.be.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image
