    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}
The x offset of the graphic shadow
The y offset of the graphic shadow

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.sc.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction
The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction
The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.an.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.al.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.be.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.encode.hover.ba.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image
The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.setCustomizedSh.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.skipBefo.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.updateVi.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.maxChild.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridTemp.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridRowG.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridColu.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridRowS.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridRowE.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

glyph.glyphType.linkPath.layout.gridColu.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.desc: Execute registerRippleGlyph() to register the ripplePoint glyph before using it.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.animation.desc:
Implement the loop playback of ripples through the ripple channel:

{
  "channel": { "ripple": { "from": 0, "to": 1 } },
  "loop": true
}

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
Ripple change state, range is [0, 1]
Graphic element's x coordinate
Graphic element's y coordinate

Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.setCustomize.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.displ.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.callb.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.skipB.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.updat.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.maxCh.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.posit.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.paddi.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.gridT.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.gridR.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.gridC.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.gridR.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

glyph.glyphType.ripplePoint.layout.gridC.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

glyph.glyphType.wave.desc: You need to perform registerWaveGlyph() to register the wave glyph before using it

glyph.glyphType.wave.animation.desc:
You can implement the ripple loop playback through the wave channel:

{
  "channel": { "wave": { "from": 0, "to": 1 } },
  "loop": true
}

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.wave.desc: Wave change state, range is [0, 1]

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.fill.desc:

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

glyph.glyphType.wave.encode.enter.backgr.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image
The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

glyph.glyphType.wave.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.wave.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.wave.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

glyph.glyphType.wave.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

glyph.glyphType.wave.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

glyph.glyphType.wave.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

glyph.glyphType.wave.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

glyph.glyphType.wave.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.wave.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

glyph.glyphType.wave.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

glyph.glyphType.wave.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

glyph.glyphType.wave.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

glyph.glyphType.wave.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

glyph.glyphType.wave.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.skipBeforeLa.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.updateViewSi.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.maxChildWidt.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.maxChildHeig.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridTemplate.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridColumnGa.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridColumnSt.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

glyph.glyphType.wave.layout.gridColumnEn.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.axis.axisType.desc:
Set the type of axis, supporting two types of configuration:

  • 'line'
  • 'circle';

component.componentType.axis.inside.desc: Whether the coordinate axis points to the inside of the coordinate system

component.componentType.axis.baseValue.desc: Set the base value corresponding to the coordinate value, for example, the x axis corresponds to the y axis base value of 0

component.componentType.axis.scale.desc:
Set the associated scale grammar element, supporting two types of settings:

  • The id corresponding to the string grammar element
  • The instance corresponding to the IScale grammar element, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.axis.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.axis.encode.ente.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
Set the point coordinates of the upper left corner of the axis. The format is: { x: number; y: number }
Set the point coordinates of the lower right corner of the axis. The format is: { x: number; y: number }
Set the axis title configuration
Set the axis label configuration
Set the axis connection line configuration
Set the axis tick grid configuration
Set the axis secondary tick configuration
Set the axis grid configuration
Set the axis secondary grid configuration
Graphic element's x coordinate
Graphic element's y coordinate
Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics
Opacity of the graphic element rendering

  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}

}

component.componentType.axis.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.axis.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.axis.setCustomiz.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.axis.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.axis.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.axis.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.axis.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.axis.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.axis.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.axis.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.axis.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.axis.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.axis.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.axis.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.axis.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.axis.layout.disp.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.axis.layout.call.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.axis.layout.skip.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.axis.layout.upda.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.axis.layout.maxC.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.axis.layout.posi.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

component.componentType.axis.layout.padd.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.axis.layout.grid.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.crosshair.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape
Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
When used in Cartesian coordinate system, set the coordinate of the upper left corner of the axis, in the format: { x: number; y: number }
When used in Cartesian coordinate system, set the coordinate of the lower right corner of the axis, in the format: { x: number; y: number }
When used in polar coordinate system, set the origin coordinate of the coordinate system
When used in polar coordinate system, set the radius of the coordinate system
When used in polar coordinate system, set the starting angle of the coordinate system, default is 0
When used in polar coordinate system, set the ending angle of the coordinate system, default is 2 * PI
Set the line style of crosshair of type crosshairShape = 'line'
Set the rectangle style of crosshair of type crosshairShape = 'rect'
Set the graphics style of crosshair of type crosshairShape = 'rect' & crosshairType = 'angle'
Set the inner radius of the graphics of crosshair of type crosshairShape = 'rect' & crosshairType = 'angle'
Set the polygon side count of the graphics of crosshair of type crosshairShape = 'line' & crosshairType = 'radius'
Graphic element's x coordinate
Graphic element's y coordinate
Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics
Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

component.componentType.crosshair.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.crosshair.contex.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.crosshair.setCus.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.crosshair.suppor.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.crosshair.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.crosshair.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.crosshair.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.crosshair.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.crosshair.groupB.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.crosshair.groupS.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.crosshair.coordi.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.crosshair.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.crosshair.stateS.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.crosshair.transf.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.crosshair.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;
Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.datazoom.preview.desc: Set the data corresponding to the preview

Set the data syntax element corresponding to the preview data, supporting two types of settings:

  • string id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData an instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode
Same as the visual channel settings in encode
Same as the visual channel settings in encode
Same as the visual channel settings in encode
Same as the visual channel settings in encode

component.componentType.datazoom.target.desc: Set the data elements that need to be updated after datazoom triggers the data update

component.componentType.datazoom.target..desc:
Set the data syntax element corresponding to the updated data, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData The instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode

Perform filter operation on the target data element, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The field corresponding to the updated data element
  • function Custom filter function, defined as: (datum: any, value: { start: number; end: number; startRatio: number; endRatio: number }) => boolean

component.componentType.datazoom.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.datazoom.encode..desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}
Graphic element's fill opacity

The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis
The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode
The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image
