component.componentType.datazoom.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.datazoom.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.datazoom.setCust.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.datazoom.support.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.datazoom.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.datazoom.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.datazoom.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.datazoom.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.datazoom.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.datazoom.groupSo.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.datazoom.coordin.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.datazoom.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.datazoom.stateSo.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.datazoom.transfo.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.datazoom.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.datazoom.layout..desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;
Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.label.size.desc: When associating with the symbol element, set the size visual channel for the corresponding symbol

component.componentType.label.target.desc:
Associated graphics objects, supporting the association of a single graphics object or multiple graphics objects, supporting four formats of configuration:

  • string: associate a single graphics object, configure the corresponding id of the associated graphics object
  • string[]: associate multiple graphics objects, configure the corresponding ids of the associated graphics objects
  • IMark: associate a single graphics object, configure the instance of the associated graphics object, mainly used for API creation mode
  • IMark[]: associate multiple graphics objects, configure the instances of the associated graphics objects, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.label.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.label.encode.ent.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
The range of label overlap prevention calculation

Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'
The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter
The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds
Outer border
Inner border
The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}
The x offset of the graphic shadow
The y offset of the graphic shadow
The offset of the graphic in the x direction
The offset of the graphic in the y direction
The offset of the graphic in the z direction
The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction
The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction
The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1
The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis
The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode
The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

component.componentType.label.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.label.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.label.setCustomi.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.label.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.label.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.label.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.label.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.label.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.label.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.label.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.label.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.label.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.label.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.label.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.label.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.label.layout.dis.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.label.layout.cal.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.label.layout.ski.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.label.layout.upd.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.label.layout.max.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.label.layout.pos.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

component.componentType.label.layout.pad.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.label.layout.gri.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.legend.legendTyp.desc:
Set the legend type

  • 'auto' Automatically resolve based on the associated scale
  • 'discrete' Discrete type
  • 'color' Color type
  • 'size' Size type

component.componentType.legend.scale.desc:
Set the associated scale grammar element, supporting two types of settings:

  • The id corresponding to the string grammar element
  • The instance corresponding to the IScale grammar element, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.legend.target.desc: Set the data elements that need to be updated after legend triggers the data update

component.componentType.legend.target.da.desc:
Set the data syntax element corresponding to the updated data, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData The instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.legend.target.fi.desc:
Perform filter operation on the target data element, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The field corresponding to the updated data element
  • function Custom filter function, defined as: (datum: any, value: any[]) => boolean

component.componentType.legend.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.legend.encode.en.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
Allow selection for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'
Allow hover for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'
Legend items for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'
Default selected legend items for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'

Legend selection mode for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'

  • 'single'
  • 'multiple'
Allow all canceling for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'

Legend item style for discrete legends when legendType = 'discrete' or automatically calculated as 'discrete'

// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

component.componentType.legend.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.legend.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.legend.setCustom.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.legend.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.legend.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.legend.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.legend.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.legend.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.legend.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.legend.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.legend.coordinat.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.legend.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.legend.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.legend.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.legend.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.legend.layout.di.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.legend.layout.ca.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.legend.layout.sk.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.legend.layout.up.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.legend.layout.ma.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.legend.layout.po.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

component.componentType.legend.layout.pa.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.legend.layout.gr.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.player.target.desc: Set the data elements that need to be updated after player triggers the data update

component.componentType.player.target.da.desc:
Set the data syntax element corresponding to the updated data, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData The instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.player.target.so.desc:
Set data source, support three types of settings:

  • string The id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData The instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode
  • any[] custom data

component.componentType.player.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.player.encode.en.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
Data item content

  • 'top'
  • 'bottom'
  • 'left'
  • 'right'

      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}

}

component.componentType.player.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.player.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.player.setCustom.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.player.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.player.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.player.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.player.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.player.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.player.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.player.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.player.coordinat.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.player.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.player.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.player.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.player.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.player.layout.di.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.player.layout.ca.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.player.layout.sk.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.player.layout.up.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.player.layout.ma.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.player.layout.po.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

component.componentType.player.layout.pa.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.player.layout.gr.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.slider.target.desc: Set the data elements that need to be updated after slider triggers the data update

component.componentType.slider.target.da.desc:
Set the data syntax element corresponding to the updated data, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The id corresponding to the data syntax element
  • IData The instance corresponding to the data syntax element, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.slider.target.fi.desc:
Perform filter operation on the target data element, supporting two types of settings:

  • string The field corresponding to the updated data element
  • function Custom filter function, defined as: (datum: any, value: { start: number; end: number }) => boolean

component.componentType.slider.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.slider.encode.en.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.
Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [

      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%

    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }

}

component.componentType.slider.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.slider.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.slider.setCustom.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.slider.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.slider.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.slider.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.slider.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.slider.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.slider.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.slider.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.slider.coordinat.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.slider.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.slider.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.slider.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.slider.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.slider.layout.di.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.slider.layout.ca.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.slider.layout.sk.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.slider.layout.up.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.slider.layout.ma.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.slider.layout.po.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

component.componentType.slider.layout.pa.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.slider.layout.gr.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

component.componentType.tooltip.title.ke.desc:
Set the content corresponding to key, supporting multiple formats:

First Type: Return the value corresponding to key through two formats

Support two types of setting methods:

  • string type
  • function type, calculate the result through custom function, where the ts type definition of the function is:
(datum: any, el: IElement, parameters: any) => string;

The parameters are the other syntax elements that this mark syntax element depends on.

Second Type: Return the graphic attributes of the text type graphic presentation corresponding to key through two formats, which can refer to the encode settings of the type: 'text' mark

Support two types of setting methods:

  • ITextGraphicAttribute type
  • function type, calculate the result through custom function, where the ts type definition of the function is:
(datum: any, el: IElement, parameters: any) => ITextGraphicAttribute;

The parameters are the other syntax elements that this mark syntax element depends on.

Third Type: Set the value corresponding to key through the field

The type definition is:

type FieldEncodeType = {
  field: string;
};

The field setting reads the value from the corresponding field in the related data.

component.componentType.tooltip.target.desc:
Associated graphics objects, supporting the association of a single graphics object or multiple graphics objects, supporting four formats of configuration:

  • string: associate a single graphics object, configure the corresponding id of the associated graphics object
  • string[]: associate multiple graphics objects, configure the corresponding ids of the associated graphics objects
  • IMark: associate a single graphics object, configure the instance of the associated graphics object, mainly used for API creation mode
  • IMark[]: associate multiple graphics objects, configure the instances of the associated graphics objects, mainly used for API creation mode

component.componentType.tooltip.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

component.componentType.tooltip.encode.e.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

Opacity of the graphic element rendering

Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}
Graphic element's fill opacity

  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,

}
