component.componentType.tooltip.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

component.componentType.tooltip.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

component.componentType.tooltip.setCusto.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

component.componentType.tooltip.support3.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

component.componentType.tooltip.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

component.componentType.tooltip.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

component.componentType.tooltip.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

component.componentType.tooltip.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.tooltip.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

component.componentType.tooltip.groupSor.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

component.componentType.tooltip.coordina.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

component.componentType.tooltip.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

component.componentType.tooltip.stateSor.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

component.componentType.tooltip.transfor.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.d.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.c.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.s.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.u.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.m.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.p.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

component.componentType.tooltip.layout.g.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing
The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position
The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

arc3d.type.desc: Set the graphic element type as arc3d

arc3d.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

arc3d.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

arc3d.encode.enter.startAngle.desc: The starting angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.enter.endAngle.desc: The ending angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.enter.padAngle.desc:
Gap angle; the gap angle is converted into a fixed linear distance between two adjacent arcs, defined as padRadius * | padAngle |

This distance is equal at the beginning and end of the arc; The gap angle should generally only be applied to annular sectors (i.e. when the inner radius is greater than 0)

arc3d.encode.enter.cap.desc:
Corresponds to the lineCap attribute of the line segment, lineCap represents how the line segment is drawn at the end, supporting two types of settings

  • boolean: cap: true means to add an angle at the starting position of the arc line, and the angle is | outerRadius - innerRadius | / outerRadius

  • [boolean, boolean]: set different end drawing strategies for the head and tail

arc3d.encode.enter.forceShowCap.desc: When cap = true and gradient fill is used, automatically implement conical gradient, which is the circular gradient

arc3d.encode.enter.height.desc: Height of the arc

arc3d.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

arc3d.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

arc3d.encode.enter.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

arc3d.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

arc3d.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

arc3d.encode.enter.lineCap.desc:

arc3d.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

arc3d.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

arc3d.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

arc3d.encode.update.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data update state.

arc3d.encode.update.startAngle.desc: The starting angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.update.endAngle.desc: The ending angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.update.padAngle.desc:
Gap angle; the gap angle is converted into a fixed linear distance between two adjacent arcs, defined as padRadius * | padAngle |

This distance is equal at the beginning and end of the arc; The gap angle should generally only be applied to annular sectors (i.e. when the inner radius is greater than 0)

arc3d.encode.update.cap.desc:
Corresponds to the lineCap attribute of the line segment, lineCap represents how the line segment is drawn at the end, supporting two types of settings

  • boolean: cap: true means to add an angle at the starting position of the arc line, and the angle is | outerRadius - innerRadius | / outerRadius

  • [boolean, boolean]: set different end drawing strategies for the head and tail

arc3d.encode.update.forceShowCap.desc: When cap = true and gradient fill is used, automatically implement conical gradient, which is the circular gradient

arc3d.encode.update.height.desc: Height of the arc

arc3d.encode.update.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

arc3d.encode.update.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

arc3d.encode.hover.desc: Set the visual channel mapping corresponding to the graphics elements when in the hover state.

arc3d.encode.hover.startAngle.desc: The starting angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.hover.endAngle.desc: The ending angle of the arc; Specified in radians, 0 represents the 12 o'clock direction and the clockwise direction is positive. If |endAngle - startAngle| , a complete sector or ring will be drawn

arc3d.encode.hover.padAngle.desc:
Gap angle; the gap angle is converted into a fixed linear distance between two adjacent arcs, defined as padRadius * | padAngle |

This distance is equal at the beginning and end of the arc; The gap angle should generally only be applied to annular sectors (i.e. when the inner radius is greater than 0)

arc3d.encode.hover.cap.desc:
Corresponds to the lineCap attribute of the line segment, lineCap represents how the line segment is drawn at the end, supporting two types of settings

  • boolean: cap: true means to add an angle at the starting position of the arc line, and the angle is | outerRadius - innerRadius | / outerRadius

  • [boolean, boolean]: set different end drawing strategies for the head and tail

arc3d.encode.hover.forceShowCap.desc: When cap = true and gradient fill is used, automatically implement conical gradient, which is the circular gradient

arc3d.encode.hover.height.desc: Height of the arc

arc3d.encode.hover.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

arc3d.encode.hover.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

arc3d.encode.hover.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

  • Linear gradient

arc3d.encode.hover.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

arc3d.encode.hover.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

arc3d.encode.hover.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

arc3d.encode.hover.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

arc3d.encode.hover.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

arc3d.encode.hover.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

arc3d.encode.hover.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

arc3d.encode.hover.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

arc3d.encode.hover.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic

  • Radial gradient

arc3d.encode.hover.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

arc3d.encode.hover.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

arc3d.encode.hover.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

arc3d.encode.hover.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

arc3d.encode.hover.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

arc3d.encode.hover.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

arc3d.encode.hover.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

arc3d.encode.hover.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

arc3d.encode.hover.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

arc3d.encode.hover.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

arc3d.encode.hover.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

arc3d.encode.hover.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

arc3d.encode.hover.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

arc3d.encode.hover.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{

  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%

    }
  ],

  • Radial gradient

arc3d.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

arc3d.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

arc3d.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

arc3d.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

arc3d.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

arc3d.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

arc3d.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

arc3d.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

arc3d.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

arc3d.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

arc3d.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

arc3d.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

arc3d.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

arc3d.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

arc3d.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

arc3d.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

arc3d.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

arc3d.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

arc3d.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

arc3d.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

arc3d.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

arc3d.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

arc3d.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

arc3d.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

arc3d.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

arc3d.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

arc3d.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

arc3d.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

arc3d.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

arc3d.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

arc3d.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

arc3d.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

arc3d.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

arc3d.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

arc3d.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

arc3d.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

arc3d.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

arc3d.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

arc3d.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

arc3d.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

arc3d.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

arc3d.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

arc3d.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

arc3d.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

arc3d.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

arc3d.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

arc3d.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

arc3d.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

pyramid3d.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

pyramid3d.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

pyramid3d.encode.enter.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two formats:

  • number: Set a uniform border radius for all corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner separately

pyramid3d.encode.enter.face.desc:
Set the 6 faces of up, down, left, right, front, and back. The ts type definition is:

[boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean];

pyramid3d.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

pyramid3d.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

pyramid3d.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

pyramid3d.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

pyramid3d.encode.enter.lineJoin.desc:

pyramid3d.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

pyramid3d.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffe.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

pyramid3d.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

pyramid3d.encode.enter.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

pyramid3d.encode.enter.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

pyramid3d.encode.enter.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

pyramid3d.encode.enter.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

pyramid3d.encode.enter.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

pyramid3d.encode.enter.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

pyramid3d.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

pyramid3d.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

pyramid3d.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

pyramid3d.encode.enter.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

pyramid3d.encode.exit.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data deletion state.

pyramid3d.encode.exit.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two formats:

  • number: Set a uniform border radius for all corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner separately

pyramid3d.encode.exit.face.desc:
Set the 6 faces of up, down, left, right, front, and back. The ts type definition is:

[boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean];

pyramid3d.encode.exit.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

pyramid3d.encode.exit.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

pyramid3d.encode.exit.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

pyramid3d.encode.exit.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

pyramid3d.encode.exit.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

pyramid3d.encode.exit.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

pyramid3d.encode.exit.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image

  • 'progress'
  • 'wait'
  • 'cell'
  • 'crosshair'
  • 'text'
  • 'vertical-text'
  • 'alias'
  • 'copy'
  • 'move'
  • 'no-drop'
  • 'not-allowed'
  • 'grab'
  • 'grabbing'
  • 'all-scroll'
  • 'col-resize'
  • 'row-resize'
  • 'n-resize'
  • 'e-resize'
  • 's-resize'
  • 'w-resize'
  • 'ne-resize'
  • 'nw-resize'
  • 'se-resize'
  • 'sw-resize'
  • 'ew-resize'
  • 'ns-resize'
  • 'nesw-resize'
  • 'nwse-resize'
  • 'zoom-in'
  • 'zoom-out'

pyramid3d.animation.desc:
Supports setting various state corresponding animations, data-driven animation states have three types:

  • enter
  • update
  • exit

Interaction-triggered state changes are configured through a unified interaction animation, with the configuration key being state

pyramid3d.animation.type.desc:
Animation execution type, specifying a specific built-in animation execution effect

Universal built-in animation types include:

  • fadeIn/fadeOut: Fade in and out animations
  • scaleIn/scaleOut: Scaling animations
  • moveIn/moveOut: Move in and out animations
  • rotateIn/rotateOut: Rotation animations
  • update: Update animations

pyramid3d.animation.channel.desc: Visual channels before and after the animation is executed, conflicts with type configuration

pyramid3d.animation.custom.desc: Custom animation, if custom animation configuration is set, it will replace the default visual channel interpolation logic

pyramid3d.animation.oneByOne.desc: Animation execution delay time in sequence. If set to true, the next element's animation will be executed after the previous element's animation is completed. The default is false.

pyramid3d.animation.startTime.desc: Initial time of animation execution, which will not be repeatedly applied in loop animation, default is 0

pyramid3d.animation.totalTime.desc: Maximum time of animation execution, the animation will be terminated if it reaches the set time

pyramid3d.animation.loop.desc: Number of animation loops, if set to true, it will loop infinitely

pyramid3d.animation.options.desc: Additional parameters set for specific animation types execution

pyramid3d.animation.controlOptions.desc:
Control parameters for animation execution logic:

  • stopWhenStateChange: Whether to immediately terminate its animation when the animation state changes
  • immediatelyApply: Whether to immediately apply the initial visual channel of the animation

pyramid3d.zIndex.desc: Set the zIndex of the container shape (group) corresponding to the mark graphic primitive

pyramid3d.context.desc: Set the context parameters of the graphic primitive

pyramid3d.setCustomizedShape.desc:
Set the callback function of custom shape. The corresponding ts type is as follows:

(datum: any[], attrs: any, path: ICustomPath2D) => ICustomPath2D;

Where ICustomPath2D is a utility class provided by VRender for drawing custom paths.

pyramid3d.support3d.desc: Whether to support 3d mode when the canvas is set to 3d view.

pyramid3d.group.desc:
Set the parent graphic primitive. Supports two formats:

  • 'string' The id of the corresponding parent graphic primitive
  • 'IGroupMark' The corresponding grammar element of the parent graphic primitive, generally used in API call scenarios.

If not set, it will be attached to the root node of the canvas by default.

pyramid3d.from.desc:
ts type definition is:

interface MarkFromSpec {
  data: string | IData;
}

Declare the data on which the graphic primitive depends through the data attribute.

pyramid3d.key.desc:
Set the unique identifier for the graphic primitive data element, which is used to calculate the data state of the graphic element. The corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the key

pyramid3d.sort.desc:
Sort all graphic elements in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

pyramid3d.groupBy.desc:
Set the grouping attribute, the corresponding ts type definition is:

type MarkKeySpec = string | ((datum: any) => string);

That is to say, it supports two formats:

  • string Set the field corresponding to the grouping key
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the grouping key

pyramid3d.groupSort.desc:
Sort the groups in the graphic primitive and set the corresponding sorting callback function:

(datumA: any, datumB: any) => number;

pyramid3d.coordinate.desc: Set the id or graphic element corresponding to the associated coordinate system of this graphic primitive

pyramid3d.state.desc:
Set the state values of all graphical elements of the current graphic primitive, supporting three formats:

  • string Set the state of the graphic, for example, { state: 'selected'} sets the state of all graphics to 'selected', usually in this case, the encode also sets the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the 'selected' state
  • string[] Set multiple states for the graphic, you can configure stateSort to influence the order of executing the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state
  • function Customize the callback function for parsing the state value, and the return parameter is string | string[], the corresponding ts type definition is:
(datum: any, element: IElement, parameters: any) => string | string[];

pyramid3d.stateSort.desc:
Set the sorting function of the state values of all graphics elements of the current graphic primitive, which will affect the order of the graphic channel mapping corresponding to the state. The result of the graphic channel mapping executed earlier may be covered by subsequent states. The corresponding ts type definition is:

(stateA: string, stateB: string) => number;

pyramid3d.transform.desc:
Set the corresponding transformation of the graphic primitive. All data transformations can be configured on the graphic primitive and are used for the join data execution transformation; Another type of transformation is the transformation executed by graphical elements, such as dodge; The general type definition is as follows:

interface BaseTransformSpec {
  /** the type of transform */
  type: string;
  [key: string]: TransformSpecValue | TransformSpecValue[];
}

The parameters supported by each transformation are different

pyramid3d.layout.desc:
Set the layout parameters of the graphic primitive. There are two roles when the graphic primitive participates in the layout:

  • 'container' Container graphic primitive, usually group graphic primitive
  • 'item' layout child element, as a child node of the container graphic primitive

Please note that we only support one layer of layout. If it is a multi-layer nested layout, it is recommended to use a custom layout scheme for implementation;

Now support two content layouts: grid layout and relative layout, the related type definition is as follows

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

interface MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  callback?: MarkLayoutCallback;
  skipBeforeLayouted?: boolean;
  updateViewSignals?: boolean;
}

interface MarkGridContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'grid';
  gridTemplateRows?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridTemplateColumns?: (number | string | 'auto')[];
  gridRowGap?: number;
  gridColumnGap?: number;
}

interface MarkGridItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  gridRowStart?: number;
  gridRowEnd?: number;
  gridColumnStart?: number;
  gridColumnEnd?: number;
}

interface MarkRelativeContainerSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  display: 'relative';
  maxChildWidth?: string | number;
  maxChildHeight?: string | number;
}

interface MarkRelativeItemSpec extends MarkBaseLayoutSpec {
  position?: 'top' | 'bottom' | 'left' | 'right' | 'content' | 'auto' | string;
  padding?: CommonPaddingSpec;
}

If you want to set a custom layout scheme, layout also supports setting callback functions directly. The definition of the callback function is as follows:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

pyramid3d.layout.display.desc:
The container graphic primitive sets the layout type and supports two configurations:

  • 'relative' Relative layout
  • 'grid' Grid layout

pyramid3d.layout.callback.desc:
Customize the callback function for this graphic primitive, the ts type definition is:

type MarkLayoutCallback = (
  group: IGroupMark,
  children: IMark[],
  parentLayoutBounds: Bounds,
  options?: ILayoutOptions
) => void;

pyramid3d.layout.skipBeforeLayouted.desc: Skip the execution stage before the layout is completed

pyramid3d.layout.updateViewSignals.desc:
Whether to update the default view signals, that is: padding, viewWidth and viewHeight

This property can only be set on a container graphic primitive with 'relative' layout.

pyramid3d.layout.maxChildWidth.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum width of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the width of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

pyramid3d.layout.maxChildHeight.desc:
The parent graphic primitives of the relative layout set the maximum height of the child graphic primitives, supporting two formats:

  • 'string' Percentage string, such as '20%', the denominator corresponds to the height of the bounding box of the container graphic primitive
  • 'number' Unit is px, set the absolute width

pyramid3d.layout.position.desc:
Set the position of the child graphic primitive of the relative layout. The supported settings are:

  • 'top' Relative to the top of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'bottom' Relative to the bottom of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'left' Relative to the left side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'right' Relative to the right side of the parent graphic primitive
  • 'content' Relative to the center of the parent graphic primitive, that is, the content area
  • 'auto' When the graphic primitive sets the coordinate system, the position relative to the parent graphic primitive is automatically calculated according to the associated scale

pyramid3d.layout.padding.desc:
The inner padding of Child graphic primitive, in px unit, with the default padding of 0 for all directions. Accepts numerical values, numerical arrays, and objects for settings.

Example of usage:

// Numerical type, set the padding to 5
padding: 5;
// Numerical array, set the top and bottom padding to 5, and the left and right padding to 10, similar to the CSS box model
padding: [5, 10];
// Numerical array, set the padding for all four directions separately
padding: [
  5, // Top
  10, // Right
  5, // Bottom
  10 // Left
];
// Object type
padding: {
  top: 5,
  right: 10,
  bottom: 5,
  left: 10
}

pyramid3d.layout.gridTemplateRows.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row height

pyramid3d.layout.gridTemplateColumns.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column width

pyramid3d.layout.gridRowGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row spacing

pyramid3d.layout.gridColumnGap.desc: The parent graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column spacing

pyramid3d.layout.gridRowStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row start position

pyramid3d.layout.gridRowEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the row end position

pyramid3d.layout.gridColumnStart.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column start position

pyramid3d.layout.gridColumnEnd.desc: The child graphic primitive of the grid layout sets the column end position

pyramid3d.large.desc: Whether to enable large data rendering mode

pyramid3d.largeThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling large data rendering optimization, corresponding to the length of data

pyramid3d.progressiveStep.desc: The step length for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of data in each shard

pyramid3d.progressiveThreshold.desc: The threshold for enabling progressive rendering, corresponding to the length of single series data

pyramid3d.morph.desc: Whether to enable global transition morph animations for the current graphic element

pyramid3d.morphKey.desc: Used to match graphic elements for global transition morph animations, graphic elements with the same morphKey will undergo morph animations

pyramid3d.morphElementKey.desc: For the matched graphic elements before and after, use this configuration to match the graphic element; if not declared, we will read the key configuration by default to match the graphic element for morph animations; Supports one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-one graphic morph animations by default

rect3d.encode.desc:
Set the visual channel encoding of the graphics elements, supporting three data change states by default:

  • enter newly added data items
  • update data items have been updated
  • exit data items are deleted

Note that the data state here is automatically generated based on the mark's key. We will calculate the unique identifier for the data bound to the mark based on the key configuration. After the data is updated, if the corresponding unique identifier no longer exists, the state is exit; if it exists, it is update. If the previous data does not exist for the unique identifier, the data item's state is enter.

Supports one interaction state by default:

  • hover when the mouse hovers over a specific shape, set the corresponding visual channel encoding for the shape

rect3d.encode.enter.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data initialization state. Note that it will not be executed again when the data is updated.

rect3d.encode.enter.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two types of setting:

  • number: Set the same border radius for all four corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner
    • When the array length is 1, set the same border radius for all four corners
    • When the array length is 2 or 3, set border radius of top-left and bottom-right corners to borderRadius[0], and border radius of top-right and bottom-left corners to borderRadius[1]
    • When the array length is 4 or more, set different border radius for each corner

rect3d.encode.enter.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

rect3d.encode.enter.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

rect3d.encode.enter.stroke.desc:
Graphic element's stroke color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient

    },

    }
  ]

  • Conical gradient

    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

rect3d.encode.enter.lineWidth.desc: Line width of the graphic element's stroke

rect3d.encode.enter.lineDash.desc: Type: number[] Line pattern mode of the graphic element's stroke

rect3d.encode.enter.lineDashOffset.desc: Offset of the graphic element's stroke line pattern mode

rect3d.encode.enter.lineCap.desc:
Line cap style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'butt'
  • 'round'
  • 'square'

rect3d.encode.enter.lineJoin.desc:
Line join style of the graphic stroke, with the following optional options:

  • 'bevel'
  • 'miter'
  • 'round'

rect3d.encode.enter.miterLimit.desc: The limit value for the miter effect when the lineJoin type is miter

rect3d.encode.enter.strokeBoundsBuffer.desc: The boundsBuffer of the graphic stroke for controlling the buffer of the bounds

rect3d.encode.enter.shadowBlur.desc: The blur radius size of the graphic shadow

rect3d.encode.enter.shadowColor.desc:
The shadow color of the graphic. Supports setting to solid colors using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc., and also supports setting to gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%

    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

rect3d.encode.enter.shadowOffsetX.desc: The x offset of the graphic shadow

rect3d.encode.enter.shadowOffsetY.desc: The y offset of the graphic shadow

rect3d.encode.enter.dx.desc: The offset of the graphic in the x direction

rect3d.encode.enter.dy.desc: The offset of the graphic in the y direction

rect3d.encode.enter.dz.desc: The offset of the graphic in the z direction

rect3d.encode.enter.scrollX.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the X direction

rect3d.encode.enter.scrollY.desc: The scrolling offset of the graphic in the y direction

rect3d.encode.enter.scaleX.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the x direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

rect3d.encode.enter.scaleY.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the y direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

rect3d.encode.enter.scaleZ.desc: The scaling factor of the graphic in the z direction, default is no scaling, which is equivalent to a value of 1

rect3d.encode.enter.angle.desc: The rotation angle of the graphic in the x-y plane, in 3d mode, corresponds to the rotation angle around the z-axis

rect3d.encode.enter.alpha.desc: The rotation angle around the y-axis in 3d mode

rect3d.encode.enter.beta.desc: The rotation angle around the x-axis in 3d mode

rect3d.encode.enter.background.desc:
The background color of the graphic, or the background image;

When setting the background color, supports using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, etc. to set solid colors, and also supports setting gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,
  y0: 0,
  x1: 0,
  y1: 1,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: 'blue' // Color at 100%
    }
  ],
}
  • Radial gradient
// Radial gradient, the first five parameters are x0, y0, r0, x1, y1, r1, where r0 and r1 represent radius, values are the same as linear gradient
{
  gradient: 'radial',
  x0: 0.5,
  y0: 0,
  r0: 0,
  x1: 0.5,
  y1: 1,
  r1: 0.7,
  stops: [
    {
      offset: 0,
      color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' // Color at 0%
    },
    {
      offset: 1,
      color: '#6690F2' // Color at 100%
    }
  ]
}
  • Conical gradient
// Conical gradient, startAngle represents starting radian, endAngle represents ending radian, x and y are coordinates, and the value range is 0 - 1
{
  gradient: 'conical',
  x: 0.5,
  y: 0.5,
  startAngle: 0,
  endAngle: 6.283185307179586,
  stops: [
    { offset: 0, color: 'red' },      // Color at 0%
    { offset: 0.2, color: 'blue' },   // Color at 20%
    { offset: 0.4, color: 'orange' }, // Color at 40%
    { offset: 0.6, color: 'pink' },   // Color at 60%
    { offset: 0.8, color: 'green' },  // Color at 80%
    { offset: 1, color: 'purple' }    // Color at 100%
  ],
}

When setting images:

Image, supporting multiple formats:

  • string: Image URL
  • HTMLImageElement: The image tag corresponding to the image
  • HTMLCanvasElement: The canvas tag corresponding to the image

rect3d.encode.enter.backgroundMode.desc: The fill mode of the graphic background, depending on the specific graphic

rect3d.encode.enter.cursor.desc:
The mouse cursor style of the graphic, similar to DOM styles:

  • 'auto'
  • 'default'
  • 'none'
  • 'context-menu'

rect3d.encode.update.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data update state.

rect3d.encode.update.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two types of setting:

  • number: Set the same border radius for all four corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner
    • When the array length is 1, set the same border radius for all four corners
    • When the array length is 2 or 3, set border radius of top-left and bottom-right corners to borderRadius[0], and border radius of top-right and bottom-left corners to borderRadius[1]
    • When the array length is 4 or more, set different border radius for each corner

rect3d.encode.update.z.desc: Graphic element's z coordinate, only applicable to 3D graphics

rect3d.encode.update.fill.desc:
Graphic element's fill color. Supports setting solid color using rgb(255,255,255), rgba(255,255,255,1), #fff, and gradient color fills.

Gradient color configuration. Gradient colors can be configured on color-supporting properties such as fill and stroke in graphic styles. Currently supports three gradient configurations:

  • Linear gradient
// Linear gradient, the first four parameters are x0, y0, x1, y1, ranging from 0 to 1, which is equivalent to the percentage within the bounding box of the graphic
{
  gradient: 'linear',
  x0: 0,

  stops: [

      color: 'red' // Color at 0%
    },

    }
  ],

rect3d.encode.exit.desc: Set the visual channel mapping executed by the graphics elements in the data deletion state.

rect3d.encode.exit.borderRadius.desc:
Set the border radius, default is 0, support two types of setting:

  • number: Set the same border radius for all four corners
  • number[]: Set different border radius for each corner
    • When the array length is 1, set the same border radius for all four corners
    • When the array length is 2 or 3, set border radius of top-left and bottom-right corners to borderRadius[0], and border radius of top-right and bottom-left corners to borderRadius[1]
    • When the array length is 4 or more, set different border radius for each corner
